title: Here’s what fantasy football experts are saying about Patriots players in Week 1
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Drake Maye is seen as a Week 1 fantasy 'sleeper' against the Raiders' middling pass defense, per NFL.com's Marcas Grant.
Rhamondre Stevenson is expected to lead the Patriots in carries against the Raiders, despite rookie attention, The Athletic reports.
Stefon Diggs is ready for Week 1 without limitations, providing a boost to both Drake Maye and the Patriots' offense, according to ESPN.

title: Hundred-year book debate: Which 1926 classic still stands the test of time?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The Hundred-Year Book Debate discusses eight notable books from 1926, including Hemingway's 'The Sun Also Rises' and Milne's 'Winnie-the-Pooh'.
Readers can vote for their favorite 1926 book until September 27, with a live debate scheduled for February 10, 2026, at the Boston Public Library.
Boston.com invites the public to suggest modern books that may still hold significance in 2126 for potential feature in future articles.

title: As Fernandes Anderson’s sentencing looms, read what Boston city councilors wrote in letters to judge
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Former Boston City Councilor Tania Fernandes Anderson faces sentencing on federal wire fraud and theft charges.
Councilors Brian Worrell, Julia Mejia, and Liz Breadon submitted letters urging leniency for Fernandes Anderson.
Letters from supporters suggest at-home confinement instead of prison, citing her community contributions and personal character.

title: Two-thirds of BPS school buses were on time on day 1. Here’s how that compares to last year.
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Boston Public Schools reported a 66% on-time rate for buses on the first day of school, the highest on record.
BPS officials noted significant improvement from last year's 34% on-time rate, citing operational reforms as key to progress.
More than 20,000 students used district buses, with 94% arriving within 30 minutes of the start time.

title: Look inside Back Bay’s Sheraton Boston after a $100 million renovation
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Sheraton Boston in Back Bay completed a $100 million renovation, reimagining its lobby, guest rooms, dining, and meeting spaces.
The renovated hotel features updated rooms with views, ambient lighting, sit-stand desks, and Sheraton Signature Beds.
New amenities include a redesigned pool deck with cabanas, a 24-hour fitness studio, and expanded event and dining options.

title: Insider predicts how Alex Bregman, Trevor Story will handle player options with Red Sox this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Alex Bregman is expected to opt out of his Red Sox contract after 2025, seeking a longer-term deal.
Trevor Story is likely to stay with the Red Sox, opting in for the final two years of his contract.
If Bregman leaves, Marcelo Mayer may take over third base, impacting infield configuration for the 2026 season.

title: Roman Anthony played a big role getting the Red Sox into playoff position. It’s on the veterans to play into October.
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Roman Anthony, key to Red Sox's turnaround, is out 4-6 weeks with a left oblique strain.
Red Sox currently trail Blue Jays in AL East by 3.5 games, with a strong playoff berth chance.
Veterans like Trevor Story and Masataka Yoshida must step up in Anthony's absence for playoff push.

title: Review: ‘The Paper’ shows promise, even as ‘The Office’ legacy looms large
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Paper' is a spinoff of 'The Office,' now streaming its first season on Peacock.
The show features Domhnall Gleeson and Oscar Nuñez, with Greg Daniels as co-creator.
'The Paper' follows a fictional newspaper struggling with corporate cuts and aims for humor similar to 'The Office.'

title: Randy Moss opened up about cancer battle, support he received, and helping Deion Sanders
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Randy Moss was diagnosed with Stage 2 bile-duct cancer in late 2024 and is now in remission.
Moss underwent a six-hour surgery, chemotherapy, and radiation therapy as part of his cancer treatment.
Moss supported Deion Sanders, who also faced cancer, drawing parallels to his brother's sudden death in 2019.

title: 2 young adults killed in midday N.H. crash
author: John Waller
bullets: A 25-year-old woman and an 18-year-old man from Barrington were killed in a crash on Route 125.
The crash involved two passenger vehicles and a commercial vehicle near Newtown Plains Road at 1 p.m. Wednesday.
An 83-year-old woman was injured and hospitalized; the crash remains under investigation by police.
